item.title: A different idea for funding #FOSS: “Support open source that your company uses by paying the maintainers to talk to your team” https://simonwillison.net/2022/Feb/23/support-open-source/

Do you like playing #piano? With the #OpenPianosMap, you can find public pianos to play all around the world. And with its companion #MapContrib theme, it's never been easier to add the ones you run across. - Map: https://www.mapcontrib.xyz/t/e5c83c-OpenPianosMap - Project: https://github.com/brunetton/OpenPianosMap #OpenStreetMap
Let’s meet a new #OpenStreetMap fellow. The OpenCage Blog interviews Abdoullah ibn Ismaïl, mapper in #Guinea: https://blog.opencagedata.com/post/openstreetmap-in-guinea.

Create a Wi-Fi Manager for your #ESP8266 #NodeMCU projects. This way, you can connect (and later change) the board to a Wi-Fi network without hard-coding network credentials (SSID and password) in the application code. https://randomnerdtutorials.com/esp8266-nodemcu-wi-fi-manager-asyncwebserver/ #IoT #Arduino

Looking for speakers / trainers for skillshare session on “Creating OSM Diary and Editing OSM Wiki”. Would you like to speak on either of those topic ? See how in this post: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/arnalielsewhere/diary/398601 #OpenStreetMap #OSM #Wiki
#OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM flies (figuratively…) to Sudan to let use meet Mustafa Kamil: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/02/01/mustafa-kamil.html.
#OpenStreetMap Belgium’s Mapper of the Month #MotM is Koos Krijnders, neighbor from The Netherlands: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2022/01/01/koos-krijnders.html
Learn #RegEx step by step, from zero to advanced: https://regexlearn.com.
#OpenStreetMap Mapper of the Month #MotM goes to Russia this time to let us meet d1sr4n: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/12/01/d1sr4n.html.

A quick start guide to create a web map with the Python-based web framework Django using its module #GeoDjango, the PostgreSQL database with its spatial extension #PostGIS and #Leaflet, a JavaScript library for interactive maps. https://www.paulox.net/2021/07/19/maps-with-django-part-2-geodjango-postgis-and-leaflet/#maps-with-django-part-2-geodjango-postgis-and-leaflet
It’s now super easy to welcome new #OpenStreetMap mappers in your country or region. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/LCCWG/diary/398057 Are you systematically welcoming new mappers in your area?
#OpenStreetMap mapping in #JOSM with a console game controller: https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/SherbetS/diary/398043. Curious to see a video demo…
The #OpenStreetMap Mapper of the Month series continues with the personal introduction of Daskarel: https://openstreetmap.be/en/motm/2021/11/01/dasrakel.html
Reimagining the #OSM User Profile. Ideas to improve the user profile UI on #OpenStreetMap. https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/PlayzinhoAgro/diary/397900

Open Etymology Map lets you discover what a street is named after based on #Wikidata referenced in #OpenStreetMap. And not only can you view but you can contribute as well. https://mapcomplete.osm.be/etymology #etymology

The #OpenStreetMap Local Chapters and Communities Working Group #LCCWG invites their 2021 Congress online on November 6 where local leaders and members come together to share stories and learn from each other. https://wiki.osmfoundation.org/wiki/Local_Chapters_and_Communities_Working_Group

What does it mean for a #map to be high quality? According to #TomTom: 1. It must look great (display quality) 2. It must have great routing (data quality) 3. It must be searchable for what you want (geocoding quality) https://www.tomtom.com/blog/maps/the-battle-for-quality-maps/ #OpenStreetMap

Looking for moderators for #OSM lists: https://blog.openstreetmap.org/2021/10/17/looking-for-moderators-for-osm-lists/. Volunteers are needed from all corners of the global #OpenStreetMap community to participate in the Moderation Team to lead efforts to keep the lists safe, welcoming, and inclusive.

The European Cyclists’ Federation (#Brussels, #Belgium) is looking for an #intern who knows how to use #OpenStreetMap data to research and analyse cycling infrastructure in Europe and produce reports that strengthen ECF’s ability to influence EU policies: https://ecf.com/sites/ecf.com/files/Vacancy%20for%20reopening%20of%20Infrastructure%20Policy%20Intern_autumn%202021_0.pdf #jobs

Interesting post about the role of the #OpenStreetMap Engineering Working Group #EWG (and the role you could play in it, if you’re interested in the ecosystem): https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/drolbr/diary/397778
